title: Banks help FTSE 100 bounce back despite U.S.-China trade jitters
text:
Banks help FTSE 100 bounce back despite U.S.-China trade jitters

Stock Markets 16 minutes ago (Oct 09, 2019 08:36)

(Reuters) - Gains in financial shares helped London stocks stage a recovery on Wednesday, even as the U.S.-China relationship strained ahead of a critical two-day meeting where the economic powerhouses will try to reach a resolution on trade. The FTSE 100 ( ) edged up 0.1% by 0705 GMT, while the FTSE 250 ( ) rose 0.2%. Just Eat (L: ) climbed 1.4% to top gainers on the blue-chip bourse after its Dutch rival Takeaway.com (AS: ) reported a surge in quarterly orders. Among midcaps, GVC (L: ) added 3%. The Ladbrokes (LON: ) owner boosted its annual core earnings target for the second time in three months on robust demand in its betting shops despite tighter regulation.

Banks help FTSE 100 bounce back despite U.S.-China trade jitters
description: Banks help FTSE 100 bounce back despite U.S.-China trade jitters
